CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Hardaway, housewife, Hill District and Mrs. Ine Rubenstein, housewife, Shadyside, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 20, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe fares would be lower and service better on trolleys and buses if the city owned and operated these services?" Mrs. Hardaway's answer reads: "I don't think that it could be any worse." Mrs. Rubenstein's answer reads: "Yes, I do.  And the first thinking which should be done, it the city took over the transit system would be to eliminate all trolleys."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mary Hardaway wearing patterned skirt and earrings, posed outdoors in front of trees, cars, and buildings; Portrait of Ine Rubenstein wearing light colored opened collared shirt with rolled up cuffs, standing outdoors with Amoco station in background
